tweet: Just voted to cancel President Trump's "national emergency" and block him from talking money from our military to fund his unnecessary border wall. Our servicemembers and their families should not be pawns in political fights, especially just to satisfy a campaign promise.

President Trump is diverting tax dollars from our military for an unnecessary border wall just to fulfill a promise to his base. Congressional opposition is bipartisan because it hurts our servicemembers and their families, our national security, and violates the Constitution. https://twitter.com/politico/status/1176907509015228416 …
Considering the threat to our national interest and national security, I would think my Republican colleagues would be natural allies.

I call on my Republican colleagues, especially those who have privately expressed exasperation with the President, to join with Democrats and protect the integrity of the office of the Presidency and our democracy.

The Director of National Intelligence has refused to send the whistleblower complaint to Congress as required by law.

It has always been my approach to be as deliberate as possible when facing issues of this importance, especially when looking for unity from across the aisle.

It adds to a growing list of illegal acts abuse of power showing this President does not have either the capacity or the interest to follow the rule of law. The President admitted he made the call, leveraging the power of his office to get what he wanted from a head of State.

It is time to open an impeachment inquiry. To not move forward would make Congress complicit in the President's behavior. President Trump’s actions surrounding Ukraine epitomize his disregard for checks and balances as well as normal practices and protocols.

Delighted to join my colleagues - @RepScottPeters, @RepMikeLevin, and @RepPeteAguilar - in sharing our experiences and priorities with the @SDChamber's annual delegation to DC. I’m glad to see San Diegans are out in force explaining our perspectives in Washington this week! pic.twitter.com/utt6NJxomW

I support community health centers and I stand with the 29 million patients that rely on on these organizations to provide affordable care to all. We must extend community health center funding on a long-term basis. #ValueCHCs @HCPSOCAL @HCAdvocacy

At an ed hearing on school gun violence, I asked for a show of hands from witnesses on who think arming teachers will end gun violence. Not one hand went up. We need:

✅Universal background checks
✅Red Flag Laws
✅Assault weapon ban
✅High capacity magazine ban
#EndGunViolence
